Pre-Game Insights: Azerbaijan will hope to pick up where they left off against Kazakhstan as they look to get their Nations League campaign off on a high, following their disappointing run in the European Championship qualifiers.
Sweden will head into Thursday’s clash looking to get one over Azerbaijan, having suffered a 3-0 loss in their last meeting, which came in the Euro 2024 qualifiers back in November.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Azerbaijan and Sweden lock horns in the UEFA Nations League on Thursday in Group 1 of League C and will battle with Slovakia and Estonia to gain promotion.
This will be the fifth meeting between the two nations, with Sweden picking up three wins in their four previous encounters.
Sweden have failed to win five of their last six competitive away games, losing four and picking up one draw since June 2022.
Azerbaijan have won just two of their last eight competitive matches while losing five and claiming one draw since March 2023.
Others: The two meetings between Azerbaijan and Sweden last year saw a combined eight goals scored and we anticipate another thrilling contest at the Tofiq Bahramov Stadium.
Given the gulf in quality and depth between the two nations, we are backing Tomasson’s men to secure an opening-day victory.
